Not going to lie, as a dragon quest fan. The 3ds version is actually better, on top of essentially having a snes version of the game, an entire town is cut out of the ps4 version that allows you to visit areas of past dragon quest games.

I wouldnt doubt it. They need all the reasons they can to get people to double dip on the game after ps4/3ds versions in japan. Edit: You guys gotta realize they are tryin to sell Dragon Quest XI to japan a third time probably 2 years after its release. I fully believe they would add as much as they can to push another sale. Its not about the west, the series isnt popular here. Ive waited years for DQ games to come and some of them not ever showing up (doesnt help its popularity chances by dropping it near spiderman either). Japan is their target and the Switch is popular there. Theres a reason why the ps4 didnt get a mode that was a snes version of the game, an extra dungeon, a town with sidequests that let you visit past towns in other dragon quest games. There are various reasons why the 3ds versions didnt get alot of features the jp ps4 version got like more town exploration, a crossbow aim mode, the world being more like an ecosystem etc. Hell, even our western version got a sprint function, and voice acting to make it different. They try to make the versions different enough to warrant a purchase. With the switch version pretty much being built in UE4 more than likey theyll just just do a best of both worlds situation and throw in the soundtrack to get people to want to buy the game the third time. I would totally not be suprised if they did that is what im saying.
Yea dood i have no clue why. The snes graphics i kinda get, but for the town beats me.

Its not about selling a switch. Its about getting people to triple dip, the switch is already popular in japan. Japan has had two versions of the Dragon Quest XI and they are planning a third one for switch. The west is not their main audience, Japan is their number 1 target. I could totally see them having an orchestrated soundtrack among other things in order to try to sell this game to japan for a third time.

Cant really blame them when no one really bought the 3ds versions of dq7 and dq8 here. Why would they drop another game on a console where it seems they dont want dragon quest/dying out over seas. I honestly wouldnt be suprised if we see another mhw situation and DQ becomes alot more popular on the ps4 in the west (not mainstream but maybe around persona status).

Dragon Quest 7 3ds version sold 1.31M in japan, .12M in US and .13M Europe. Dragon Quest 8 3ds version sold .88M in japan, .13M US, .11M Europe. These games were dropped in 2016 and 2017 respectively. Yet people wonder why they wont bring us the 3ds version. Dragon Quest 8 is the last big reference they have on playstation since theyve have been dropping nothing but spinoffs since 2004 in the west. They wanted to give Dragon Quest a chance to thrive in the west. With the switch version not ready they only have 3ds and ps4. With two failed attempts on 3ds already, they decided to opt for ps4 and go with steam as well.

No i am considering those. You are comparing stats of an american release of a 3ds game (released within the last 2 years) vs an american release of a ps1 and a ps2 game (which released 14 years ago).The ps1 and ps2 are not getting dqxi, the ps4 is they dont know how it will do but felt it was better off trying there rather than attempting the 3ds again. You cant blanket statement the audience of two different consoles. For example DQ9 sold really well on the ds in america, 3ds dq games did not. You also shouldnt be looking at ratios as a measure because if a ps4 version in japan sold 4 and 1 in us vs 4M japan and 1M us on a nintendo console. The ratio is the same, but clearly one did horrible. Also PS sales have little to no relevance at all since the ps sales didnt affect the 3ds not getting dqxi port. If the 3ds games would have sold well, then the west would also be getting dq on the 3ds. The 3ds outsold the ps4 version, but not by too much in japan (which was suprising). Considering that home consoles are more popular in the west (playstation even more im europe), and both recent 3ds releases having around .25M sales. What sense does it make to drop a 3ds version in the west when the ps4 is more popular and the switch is becoming a hit as well. I'm not saying I don't want Dragon Quest 11 on the 3DS but I am saying is that the decision made sense. Im more upset they announced it on NX and they still have nothing to show for it.

After playing persona 4 golden on the vita and persona 3 portable, Im convinced persona is much more suitable for handhelds than home consoles. So hopefully either Sony drops a new handheld, or they bring persona to switch too.

Im confused. Isnt the entire point of this game to provide new go players, very young players, and old players who fell out of pokemon years ago an entrance point to how pokemon is today while minimizing the amount of entry barriers to the game? I dont see how being a casual introduction game is a bad thing, so why are people treating it like a bad thing?

Right but the entire game is designed around a specific set of people. Which by design choices are very young players and Go players. All the games are good entrance points because they are always designed assuming you dont know how to play pokemon. But this one in particular is for getting Go players to transition into the main games which is why alot of the changes are made to resemble Go alot. It has nothing to do with the game being easy cuz all of them are easy like you said. They are trying to make the game as appealing as possible to Go players which is why they told us from the beginning gen 8 was still coming and this isnt how pokemon is going to progress. There is no real reason for hardcore fans to be upset about this game other than us just being impatient.
Good, from the TGS footage i saw it needed to be touched up a bit.

But it doesnt warrant $60 imo especially when Kanto had the least amount of post game of any pokemon game, not to mention this game actually losing stuff you can do post game like breeding. So im hoping at least they add another story bit like the delta episode or something and its not just "Fight Mewtwo". The cutscenes look so much better than S/M tho. EDIT: An interview 10/15 has detailed there will be master trainers in the post game that will provide more of a challenge. Thank god they added something to make up gen 1 lack of post game.

Because we know for sure breeding, battle spot, wondertrade and stuff isnt in, since those were officially confirmed. Meltan could possibly add something when you capture it but there is no evidence of that yet. There is probably no battle tower like FR/LG since we dont have ability or held items either. The only thing officially confirmed is the battle vs mewtwo and thats the only post game kanto really had in gen1. So for $60 i hope they added something else too.
Guess you just need to have them in your bag or somethin?
They had alot more than this and at a lower price too. So i doubt this is the only thing they have for post game.
What would be the dungeons?

Mat from NPD mentioned that DQ XI earned over double the revenue of any past DQ, including previous best (DQ IX). However, what Mat may have overlooked is that NPD used to give sales numbers for some games back in 2010: http://www.gamasutra.com/view/news/29893/Nintendo_Titles_Again_Reign_Over_NPD_Top_20_In_July.php Apparently DQ 9 sold 132,000 copies in NA in July 2010. This would, at a $40 price tag, translate to $5.28 million in revenue. Double this would be $10.56 million. At $60 per copy of PS4, we can safely say this is at least 176,000 units in NA on PS4. However the tweet is "more than double", so 176,000 units is kind of the low end. However, we can safely assume that if it had been "more than triple", then Mat would have said as much, so it's likely less than 264,000 copies ($5.28 million * 3 / $60). I think it's probably closer to 176,000 than 264,000 as if it was 250,000 he might have said "close to triple", but that's speculation. Thus, the estimate for PS4 copies in NA using NPD numbers is nearly confirmed to be somewhere between 176,000 and 264,000. This lines up VERY closely with my above estimate of 175,000 to 250,000 based on NPD placement and estimated Super Mario sales, so I think we have a pretty solid foundation for the total number of US PS4 copies + Worldwide PC copies. We still don't have much information on Europe / other parts of the world beside them showing up as #2 on the weekly charts and then disappearing below top 10. The estimated number would include the US PC/Steam sales too. Taken from r/dragonquest post by u/OhUmHmm

I personally dont care if its random or overworld tbh. But I will say, if they plan to do overworld encounters the world needs to be bigger as well as a lower spawn rate. When you dont have the room to actually avoid stuff in dungeons it is actually worse than random encounters.

WRITING.TEXT: Because people take stuff from reddit and [repost it](https://i.kym-cdn.com/photos/images/original/001/079/173/ed2.png) on other social media sites without giving credit. So its literally just a safety precaution. Most of the times if I have to put in no work to actual put something together its not worth a watermark. Not like this is the most impressive video edit I've done or anything, but I like to feel the time I put into making this isnt just attributed to someone else when they 100% had no part in the actual content.

Here is what the [watermark](https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/307765214051303427/559097958029590538/Screenshot_20190323-153504_Twitter.jpg) [does](https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/307765214051303427/559097958029590540/Screenshot_20190323-153455_Twitter.jpg)
Yea lol. But exposure is exposure, if i can keep making decently funny stuff people will see the name and notice me eventually. Hopefully... :(

Are you asking why i put my twitter handle in the vids? Or are you asking why am i wasting hours of life making these stupid edits just because it makes me a little happy to see people enjoy my dumb jokes? Cuz honestly idk.

WRITING.TITLE: The Nintendo Switch version of Team Sonic Racing makes it nearly impossible to play on the same team as friends online
WRITING.TEXT: The Switch (\*and PC) version of this game is missing the party/invite system that allows you to make teams with your friends and play against other random teams online. In the switch version to even be put in the same team is uneccesarily complex. Teams are broken 4 colors online, Blue, Red, Yellow, and Green and 3 people are on each team. The first person into the lobby will be on Blue, then next person on Green, then next on Red and so on. So if you wanted to be on team blue you have to hope you join the lobby first, then hope your friends join the lobby 5th and 9th to be on the same team, ON TOP of hoping the matchmaking puts you into the same lobby in the first place. On top of that when the race end, if someone exits the lobby it moves everyone up a slot changing the teams. This game is really fun playing with friends and I hope they patch in a workaround the way Rocket League has. It's just really dissapointing that I can't consistenly be on the same TEAM as my 2 friends in a TEAM racing game. The only way we can even play on the same team is to do Private Matches and play against AI. TL;DRThe Switch version of Team Sonic Racing online is gimped. It's easier to get 3 friends and play Turf War on the same team in Splatoon 2 than it is to team up and play against other teams online in Team Sonic Racing.
Honestly not even suprised. I just dont wanna abandon my friends cuz they both really wanted it on switch and cross play isnt a thing for this game so :(

From what I'm getting from the game there are 2 modes, Custom lobby and Regular matchmaking. From what I'm told the ps4/xbone version has the ability to party with friends up to 6 people and take their teams into the regular matchmaking mode. The switch version (and apparently the PC version) does not have this option. The only other way to consistently be able to play on the same team is by holding custom lobbies where they can join you there which is part of all versions of the game. There doesnt seem to be a way to take custom game lobbies into regular matchmaking and only people from the friend list can join so you cant play against randoms.
The PC version also does not have this feature it seems https://steamcommunity.com/app/785260/discussions/0/1653297026028141324/
